course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Inorganic Chemistry Laboratory
course.description: This course is the laboratory course designed for students who enrolled in CHEM 2210. Students will perform a series of inorganic experiments related to the theory learnt in courses. Students will be trained to perform a wide range of basic inorganic laboratory techniques, operate chemical instruments in laboratory, relate the physical and chemical principles and theory in practice and develop their data interpretation and analyzing skills. Experiments of the preparation of different metal complexes and organometallic compounds will be included. For CHEM students under the four-year degree only.

reviews.author: C8H9NO2
reviews.comment_content:
Expt. 1 Recrystallization of Inorganic Compounds
Expt. 2 Synthesis of Mixed Metal Oxides
Expt. 3 Molecular Orbital Calculations of Inorganic Compounds
Expt. 4 IR Spectroscopy of Simple Inorganic Compounds
Expt. 5 Spectrochemical Series
Expt. 6 Synthesis of a Paramagnetic Complex and Measurement of Magnetic Susceptibility
Expt. 7 Preparation and Analysis of an Ethanedioate Complex
(Choose one between Expt6 and Expt7)

Experiments are not that difficult, but the concepts require effort to study.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is clear and they assume that you already watch lab video before class. Technicians and TAs are helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Attendance and risk assessment
20% Lab Quiz
25% Performance in laboratory
10% Product
35% Reports

They switch the final exam to quizes before each experiment starts.

I got A+ at the end. Getting full marks for "Attendance and risk assessment" is a must. For lab quiz, it's hard to get full mark every time but at least I maintained my scores above mean. "Performance" mark is easy to get as long as you don't break glasswares. "Product" mark is also not difficult to get full mark compares to Organic Chemistry lab. However, you may need lots of time to do reports and it's hard to get full mark (I probably only manage to do that once.)
reviews.comment_workload: it's important to do pre-lab work so that you won't mass up with those quizes. Watching video they provided for preview is highly recommended since questions in quiz and report sometimes come from the videos. Overall, it's a heavy workload course.

The briefing is quite detailed. They will give you some hints about the questions in the lab report.
Briefing video (or say recording+slide) will be provided at the end of the semester.

Hard to get full marks in the lab report.
